intro: Martiodendron macrocarpon, commonly known as the large-fruited martiodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
